FuncDef:
The remote-backup-profile command binds an RBP to an interface.
The undo remote-backup-profile command unbinds an RBP from an interface.

By default, no RBP is bound to an interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an RBP.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters. The name can only contain digits, letters, underscores (_), hyphens (-), and periods (.). It cannot contain spaces.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario

To apply an RBP to an interface, run the remote-backup-profile command to bind the RBP to the interface.
An RBP can be bound to a master interface or all sub-interfaces of one master interface, but an interface can be bound only with one RBP.

Prerequisites

The following operations have been performed:

Run the remote-backup-profile command in the system view to create an RBP.
Run the vrrp-id vrid interface interface-type interface-number command to bind the RBP to a specified VRRP backup group.


Precautions

The name of the RBP to be bound to an interface must be the same as the name of the RBP created using the remote-backup-profile command in the system view.
